did.unittitle: Philadelphia Museum of Art Schools records

bioghist.p: Originally entitled the Pennsylvania Museum and School of Industrial Art, the Museum was committed to maintaining schools for the training of young artists. The School of Industrial Art was incorporated with the Museum in 1876 and separated from the PMA in 1964. Currently its name is The Philadelphia College of Art. The Textile School was created in 1884 and severed ties in 1948. It was then called the Philadelphia Textile Institute, now the Philadelphia College of Textiles and Science.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records related to several schools maintained by the Philadelphia Museum of Art. Records include; bound volumes of School Circulars (1879-1953); minutes of the Board of Governors (1943-1964); and minutes of the Board of Governors, Philadelphia Textile Institute (1943-1949). The collection also includes: 1966 Manual for Trustees of the Philadelphia College of Art; receipts for purchase of looms and equipment for stamping cloth (and a manuscript description of the process of manufacturing cloth using the looms provided by the importing firm); a copy of the music to the school song of the PMSIA (signed by the composer, Robert Elmore, and the lyricist, Thornton Oakley); subscription book for purchase of the building at Broad and Pine, 1893; misc. records, including an inventory of school property, 1914; and a 1945 commencement address by H. Wickliffe Rose.
